member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorPageBase
member.summary: Provides the base implementation and layout for most pages that render HTML for the error log.

member.name: T:Elmah.ApplicationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a non-fatal error occurs. This exception also serves as the base for all exceptions thrown by this library.

member.name: M:Elmah.ApplicationException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Elmah.ApplicationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

member.name: M:Elmah.ApplicationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.name: M:Elmah.ApplicationException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

member.name: M:Elmah.Assertions.AssertionFactory.DecodeClrTypeNamespaceFromXmlNamespace(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.remarks: Ideally, we would be able to use SoapServices.DecodeXmlNamespaceForClrTypeNamespace but that requires a link demand permission that will fail in partially trusted environments such as ASP.NET medium trust.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.ComparisonAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.IAssertion
member.summary: Provides evaluation of a context to determine whether it matches certain criteria or not.

member.name: M:Elmah.Assertions.IAssertion.Test(System.Object)
member.remarks: The context is typed generically as System.Object when it could have been restricted to System.Web.HttpContext and also avoid unnecessary casting downstream. However, using object allows simple assertions to be unit-tested without having to stub out a lot of the classes from System.Web (most of which cannot be stubbed anyhow due to lack of virtual and instance methods).

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.CompositeAssertion
member.summary: Read-only collection of instances.

member.name: T:Elmah.DataBinder
member.summary: Provides data expression evaluation facilites similar to in ASP.NET.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.RegexMatchAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.StaticAssertion
member.summary: An static assertion implementation that always evaluates to a preset value.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.TypeAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: F:Elmah.Build.Status
member.summary: This is the status or milestone of the build. Examples are M1, M2, ..., Mn, BETA1, BETA2, RC1, RC2, RTM.

member.name: P:Elmah.Build.ImageRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Gets a string representing the version of the CLR saved in the file containing the manifest. Under 1.0, this returns the hard-wired string "v1.0.3705".

member.name: T:Elmah.ConfigurationSectionHelper
member.summary: Helper class for handling values in configuration sections.

member.name: T:Elmah.Debug
member.summary: Provides methods for assertions and debugging help that is mostly applicable during development.

member.name: T:Elmah.Error
member.summary: Represents a logical application error (as opposed to the actual exception it may be representing).

member.summary: Writes the XML representation of the object.

member.summary: Reads the error data in child nodes.

member.summary: Writes the error data to its XML representation.

member.name: M:Elmah.Error.WriteXmlAttributes(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the error data that belongs in XML attributes.

member.name: M:Elmah.Error.WriteInnerXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the error data that belongs in child nodes.

member.name: M:Elmah.Error.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Exception
member.summary: Get the instance used to initialize this instance.
member.remarks: This is a run-time property only that is not written or read during XML serialization via and .

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of application in which this error occurred.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.HostName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of host machine where this error occurred.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Type
member.summary: Get or sets the type, class or category of the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source that is the cause of the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets a brief text describing the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Detail
member.summary: Gets or sets a detailed text describing the error, such as a stack trace.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.User
member.summary: Gets or sets the user logged into the application at the time of the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time (in local time) at which the error occurred.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP status code of the output returned to the client for the error.
member.remarks: For cases where this value cannot always be reliably determined, the value may be reported as zero.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.WebHostHtmlMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML message generated by the web host (ASP.NET) for the given error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.ServerVariables
member.summary: Gets a collection representing the Web server variables captured as part of diagnostic data for the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.QueryString
member.summary: Gets a collection representing the Web query string variables captured as part of diagnostic data for the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Form
member.summary: Gets a collection representing the form variables captured as part of diagnostic data for the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Cookies
member.summary: Gets a collection representing the client cookies captured as part of diagnostic data for the error.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorDetailPage
member.summary: Renders an HTML page displaying details about an error from the error log.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorDigestRssHandler
member.summary: Renders an RSS feed that is a daily digest of the most recently recorded errors in the error log. The feed spans at most 15 days on which errors occurred.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorHtmlPage
member.summary: Renders an HTML page displaying the detailed host-generated (ASP.NET) HTML recorded for an error from the error log.

member.summary: Initializes the module and prepares it to handle requests.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Schedules the error to be e-mailed asynchronously.
member.remarks: The default implementation uses the to queue the reporting.

member.summary: Schedules the error to be e-mailed synchronously.

member.summary: Fires the event.

member.summary: Determines whether the module will be registered for discovery in partial trust environments or not.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailSender
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the sender.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailRecipient
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the recipient, or a comma-/semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses in case of multiple recipients.
member.remarks: When using System.Web.Mail components under .NET Framework 1.x, multiple recipients must be semicolon-delimited. When using System.Net.Mail components under .NET Framework 2.0 or later, multiple recipients must be comma-delimited.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailCopyRecipient
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the recipient for mail carbon copy (CC), or a comma-/semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses in case of multiple recipients.
member.remarks: When using System.Web.Mail components under .NET Framework 1.x, multiple recipients must be semicolon-delimited. When using System.Net.Mail components under .NET Framework 2.0 or later, multiple recipients must be comma-delimited.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailSubjectFormat
member.summary: Gets the text used to format the e-mail subject.
member.remarks: The subject text specification may include {0} where the error message () should be inserted and {1} where the error type should be insert.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.SmtpServer
member.summary: Gets the SMTP server host name used when sending the mail.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.SmtpPort
member.summary: Gets the SMTP port used when sending the mail.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.AuthUserName
member.summary: Gets the user name to use if the SMTP server requires authentication.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.AuthPassword
member.summary: Gets the clear-text password to use if the SMTP server requires authentication.

member.name: T:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses memory as its backing store.
member.remarks: All instances will share the same memory store that is bound to the application (not an instance of this class).

member.name: F:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.MaximumSize
member.summary: The maximum number of errors that will ever be allowed to be stored in memory.

member.name: F:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.DefaultSize
member.summary: The maximum number of errors that will be held in memory by default if no size is specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default size for maximum recordable entries.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specific size for maximum recordable entries.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.remarks: If the log is full then the oldest error entry is removed.

member.summary: Logs an error to the database.

member.summary: ializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.name: M:Elmah.TestException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

member.name: T:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses XML files stored on disk as its backing store.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use a specific path to store/load XML files.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.Log(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Logs an error to the database.
member.remarks: Logs an error as a single XML file stored in a folder. XML files are named with a sortable date and a unique identifier. Currently the XML files are stored indefinately. As they are stored as files, they may be managed using standard scheduled jobs.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.GetErrors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Returns a page of errors from the folder in descending order of logged time as defined by the sortable filenames.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.GetError(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified error from the filesystem, or throws an exception if it does not exist.

member.name: P:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.LogPath
member.summary: Gets the path to where the log is stored.

member.name: P:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this error log implementation.
